Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class SparseDecomposition

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.SparseDecomposition
public class SparseDecomposition extends Object
Utilities for sparse matrix operations and spectral decomposition.

This class provides a lightweight sparse matrix representation in coordinate (row, column, value) form, a builder to construct such matrices and a power iteration routine to estimate the dominant eigenvalue and eigenvector. The routines operate with concurrent double vectors implemented by AtomicDoubleArray and may be used where atomic updates to vector entries are required.

Downstream uses: see AtomicDoubleArray and AtomicDouble for the concurrent vector types used by the matrix operations.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • powerIteration

      public static double[] powerIteration(SparseDecomposition.SparseMatrix A, int maxIter, double tol)
      Perform power iteration to estimate the largest eigenvalue and eigenvector.

      The routine initialises a small random vector, repeatedly applies the matrix and normalises the result using the Euclidean norm until the Rayleigh quotient converges to within tol. The returned array contains the estimated eigenvalue as the first element followed by the eigenvector components.

      Internally this method uses SparseDecomposition.SparseMatrix.multiply(AtomicDoubleArray) and normalize(AtomicDoubleArray). The eigenvector is returned with a consistent sign to reduce variability of output.

      Parameters:
      A - the sparse matrix in triple format
      maxIter - maximum number of iterations
      tol - convergence tolerance
      Returns:
      an array containing [lambda_max, v0, v1, ...]
